intro: Matelea pedunculata, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom at night. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Its foliage consists of broad, heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Matelea pedunculata is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
